.
Preparing Proposed and Final Actions
Write the proposed and final ratings so it is clear that one is a proposed rating and the other is a final decision.
The proposed rating decision
Narrative
must be provided to the beneficiary with the notice of proposed adverse action either as an attachment or by including the reasons and bases for the proposal within the body of the letter.
Include the final rating decision
Narrative
as an attachment with the final decision notice.
Notes
:
When the proposed decision would result in a reduction in combined disability evaluation if implemented, the rating decision must state the proposed combined evaluation.
If the facts contained in the proposed rating decision are complete (no additional evidence has been received or requires consideration), they do not need to be repeated in the final rating decision.  However, the final notification must include all required elements as detailed in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B.1.b
.
Include the proposed rating decision in the evidence list of the final rating decision and reference it by citing its date.
References
:  For more information on
procedures for handling notification of proposed and final rating decisions, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B
, and
generating notice of proposed adverse action letters within the Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS), see the
VBMS Core User Guide
, and
VBMS – Awards User Guide
.
